InfoText: After finishing this lesson,  you will be able to...
[ input mandatory PNR elements.
[ end the transaction.
[ identify a record locator.
<PgDn>
Before a PNR can be stored by the system,  the PNR must have a name element,
itinerary,  contact element,  ticketing element,  and received-from element.
In general,  the information may be input in any order. When the record is
complete,  the agent inputs the entry to end the transaction. To demonstrate,
display neutral availability on 18 July from FRA to ROM,  departing at 1000.
Book 1 seat in C class on the Alitalia flight departing at 1155.
The passenger name is Mr. W. Schroeder.
The client's Frankfurt business phone is 069 230858.
The client's Frankfurt home phone is 069 223774.
Arrange ticketing for 17 July.
The reservation was received from the passenger.
The PNR now has all the mandatory elements. The following transaction
codes may be used to end the transaction:
ET^       End transaction/remove from work area
ER^       End transaction/redisplay PNR
Input the entry to end the transaction and remove the PNR from the work area.
The response indicates that AMADEUS has accepted the PNR for storage. The
6-character code on the right is the record locator. This code may be used
to retrieve the PNR from storage. You will learn how to retrieve PNRs later.
<PgDn>
Which entry is used to end the transaction and redisplay the PNR?
Which entry is used to end the transaction and remove the PNR from the
agent's work area?
The following transaction codes may be used to ignore the transaction:
IG^       Ignore transaction/remove from work area
IR^       Ignore transaction/retrieve PNR from storage
Input the entry to ignore the transaction and redisplay the PNR.
A client plans to travel on 22 August from Frankfurt to Miami. He would
like the flight with the shortest elapsed time. Display availability.
LH 462 has the shortest elapsed time. Book 2 seats in V class.
The client plans to return on 30 August. Display return availability.

TerminalText: 4   AA1374  F4 Y4 G4 H4 W4 V4 K4  MIA   BOS B 1335   1651   0.M80 8
5   AA1374  F4 Y4 G4 H4 W4 V4 K4  MIA   BOS B 1335   1651   0.M80 8
InfoText: Book 2 seats in V class on the direct Lufthansa flight.
The passengers are Mr. K. Wurlitzer and Mrs. H. Wurlitzer.
Mr. Wurlitzer's Frankfurt business phone is 069 464574.
The Frankfurt home phone is 069 422533.
The clients want to purchase the tickets on 19 August.
If the received-from information is the last element to be input,  the
following entry may be used to input the received-from element and end the
transaction:
RFP;ET^
Note that ;^ is used to link the received-from entry RFP^ and the entry
to end the transaction ET^. Input this entry.
Let's review the entries for ending and ignoring the transaction. Which
entry is used to end the transaction and redisplay the PNR?
Which entry is used to ignore the transaction and remove the PNR from
the work area?
Which entry is used to end the transaction and remove the PNR from
the work area?
Which entry is used to ignore the transaction and redisplay the PNR?
What one entry may be used to indicate that the passenger requested the
reservation and then end the transaction?
You have reached the end of the lesson. Repeat this lesson until
you can finish without requesting help.
<PgDn>
